features: CRAYOLA TODDLER DOODLE BOARD: The Crayola Toddler Touch Lights Musical Doodle Board comes with 6 Songs, 12 Light Up Colors, and 1 Instruction Sheet. Requires 3 AA batteries (not included).
TODDLER SENSORY TOY: This sensory board stimulates tiny fingertips with textures and colors, promoting growth through play!
12 LIGHT COLORS: Light up each doodle with 12 vibrant colors, making every scribble a delightful, glowing spectacle!
6 SONGS: Toddlers can hum along to 6 delightful tunes that stir creativity while doodling!
MESS FREE FINGER PAINTING: Enjoy mess free finger painting right on the self-contained gel surface for stress-free playtime.
LIGHTWEIGHT & PORTABLE: Crayola Toddler Touch Lights is lightweight and portable, perfect for little hands to carry.
HOLIDAY GIFT FOR TODDLERS: This sensory board makes the perfect holiday gift for toddlers ages 2 and up.
body.description: Give your little one the power of creative play with this self-contained toddler tablet with exciting lights and sounds. The sealed gel surface is safe for doodling with fingers and perfect for mess-free, portable play. This fun toddler toy includes the touch lights unit with 6 songs and 12 colors and instructions, and requires 3 AA batteries (not included). Encourage your little one to create with a light-up toy that changes colors as toddlers make marks and scribbles, all the while listing to the accompanying music. It’s the perfect holiday gift for boys and girls! Safe for toddlers, 24 months & up.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: At a Glance: Stage 2: For daring doodlers discovering swirls, line, and shapes Multisensory play combines light, color, and sound Tablet with sealed gel surface for mess-free finger painting Doodle in 12 vibrant colors Portable design for on-the-go creative play Recommended for ages 24 months and up My First Crayola Touch Lights A Multisensory Art Experience Combining visual art, light, and sound, My First Crayola Touch Lights engages your toddler's imagination in a multisensory art experience that encourages open-ended creativity. The mess-free light-up tablet features a soft gel surface that simulates finger painting without the mess of real paint. With its 12 colored lights and 6 songs, this musical doodling board allows kids to discover sounds as they draw and doodle. My First Crayola Touch Lights requires three AA batteries (not included). What's in the Box: Touch Lights Unit with 6 Songs and 12 Colors Instructions

A Portable Art Studio My First Crayola Touch Lights has a portable design so kids can play comfortably wherever they go. Take this creative activity pad to Grandma's house, to restaurants, on the road, and more. Sealed Gel Surface for Mess-Free Finger Painting With its sealed reusable gel surface, this tablet offers the feel of finger painting but without the messy drips and cleanup. As kids place their fingers directly on the pad, they activate the colored lights and create squiggles, doodles, and free-form shapes. Stimulate Creativity with Sound My First Crayola Touch Lights adds lights and sounds to the drawing experience for additional sensory excitement. Kids can enjoy six different songs as they draw. The Colors & Tunes Button at the base of the tablet give kids easy control.

Exploring Color with My First Crayola My First Crayola offers uniquely designed tools and activities for toddlers' little hands to spark their first creative experiences. Each item in the My First Crayola lineup is specially made for each stage of a young child's creative development, exploration, and expression. Look for the stage that's right for your toddler. Stage 1: For little scribblers making their first colorful marks Stage 2: For daring doodlers discovering swirls, line, and shapes Stage 3: For budding artists ready to express their imaginations

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sensory gift
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my 2 yr old grandson. It is a great sensory gift in many ways. The soft drawing pad is fun to touch and encourages creativity. It also lights up, changes colors and plays music. Entertaining in so many ways.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this during black Friday and it was very pricey a couple of weeks later it was on sale at a cheaper price than black Friday I was upset but they toy is beautiful and fun so I let it go because it's a good investment

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Okay product for kids
reviews.reviewText: So, when I purchased this product, I thought of an etch A sketch, but it is nothing like it. I thought it would be good for my son, but it isn't the greatest product as there is no eraser to clear out the entire screen part. You are just writing over what is already there, but this is more of a scribble product and not a product you can help your child learn how to write.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good clean fun
reviews.reviewText: Finger painting fun without the clean up! Sounds can be turned off if needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Going strong 4 years later
reviews.reviewText: Bought in 2020 for my first son for Christmas and it’s still working now. My second son loves it too and kids of every age are drawn to it so I highly recommend it! It’s a good toy to last for a long time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Loved it but broke within a month

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Granddaughter loves it
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughter loves this. I love this. So simple yet so fun for her!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My son loves this and it helps because he lost interest in his sister’s video games. So cool watching him change the colors
